data.name: Exeggcute
data.flavorText: Its six eggs use telepathy to communicate among themselves. It is believed to carry plant genes and the genes of other species.

attacks.name: Continuous Eggsplosion
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

data.name: Yanmega
data.flavorText: This six-legged Pokémon is easily capable of transporting an adult in flight. The wings on its tail help it stay balanced.

attacks.name: Supersonic
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Yanma
data.flavorText: If it flaps its wings really fast, it can generate shock waves that will shatter windows in the area.

attacks.name: Super Speed
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Roselia
data.flavorText: Roselia that drink nutritionally rich springwater are said to reveal rare coloration when they bloom.

attacks.name: Petal Dance
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage for each heads. This Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Roserade
data.flavorText: With the movements of a dancer, it strikes with whips that are densely lined with poison thorns.

attacks.name: Inviting Poison
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon. The new Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Flower Tornado
attacks.text: Move any number of Grass Energy from your Pokémon to your other Pokémon in any way you like.

data.name: Turtwig
data.flavorText: It undertakes photosynthesis with its body, making oxygen. The leaf on its head wilts if it is thirsty.

attacks.name: Synthesis
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Grass Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Torterra
data.flavorText: Small Pokémon occasionally gather on its unmoving back to begin building their nests.

attacks.name: Giga Drain
attacks.text: Heal from this Pokémon the same amount of damage you did to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Earthquake
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Turtwig
data.flavorText: It undertakes photosynthesis with its body, making oxygen. The leaf on its head wilts if it is thirsty.

data.name: Grotle
data.flavorText: It knows where pure water wells up. It carries fellow Pokémon there on its back.

attacks.name: Mega Drain
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Cherubi
data.flavorText: It evolves by sucking the energy out of the small ball where it had been storing nutrients.

attacks.name: Surprise Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Cherrim
data.flavorText: If it senses strong sunlight, it opens its folded petals to absorb the sun's rays with its whole body.

abilities.name: Weather Guard
abilities.text: Your Grass Pokémon have no Weakness.

data.name: Carnivine
data.flavorText: It binds itself to trees in marshes. It attracts prey with its sweet-smelling drool and gulps them down.

attacks.name: Chomp Chomp
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Loom Over
attacks.text: This attack does 10 less damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

data.name: Mow Rotom
data.flavorText: Its body is composed of plasma. It is known to infiltrate electronic devices and wreak havoc.

abilities.name: Roto Motor
abilities.text: If you have 9 or more Pokémon Tool cards in your discard pile, ignore all Energy in the attack cost of each of this Pokémon's attacks.

attacks.name: Special Mow
attacks.text: Discard a Special Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Leafeon-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Breath of the Leaves
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, once during your turn (before your attack), you may heal 50 damage from 1 of your Pokémon that has any Energy attached to it.

attacks.name: Grand Bloom-GX
attacks.text: For each of your Benched Basic Pokémon, search your deck for a card that evolves from that Pokémon and put it onto that Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Shaymin
data.flavorText: The blooming of Gracidea flowers confers the power of flight upon it. Feelings of gratitude are the message it delivers.

attacks.name: Coax
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 Basic Pokémon of different types and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Soothing Scent
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Araquanid
data.flavorText: It delivers headbutts with the water bubble on its head. Small Pokémon get sucked into the bubble, where they drown.

abilities.name: Water Bubble
abilities.text: Prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from your opponent's Fire Pokémon.

data.name: Dewpider
data.flavorText: It crawls onto the land in search of food. Its water bubble allows it to breathe and protects its soft head.

attacks.name: Bubble
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Magmortar
data.flavorText: From its arm, it launches fireballs hotter than 3,500 degrees Fahrenheit. Its arm starts to melt when it fires a whole barrage.

abilities.name: Incandescent Body
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), the Attacking Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Fire Blaster
attacks.text: You may discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon. If you do, this attack does 80 more damage.

data.name: Magmar
data.flavorText: When angered, it spouts brilliant fire from all over its body. It doesn't calm down until its opponent has burned to ash.

attacks.name: Controlled Burn
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Chimchar
data.flavorText: The gas made in its belly burns from its rear end. The fire burns weakly when it feels sick.

data.name: Monferno
data.flavorText: It uses ceilings and walls to launch aerial attacks. Its fiery tail is but one weapon.

attacks.name: Super Singe
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

data.name: Chimchar
data.flavorText: The gas made in its belly burns from its rear end. The fire burns weakly when it feels sick.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

data.name: Infernape
data.flavorText: It tosses its enemies around with agility. It uses all its limbs to fight in its own unique style.

abilities.name: Flaming Fighter
abilities.text: Put 6 damage counters instead of 2 on your opponent's Burned Pokémon between turns.

attacks.name: Burst Punch
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

data.name: Heat Rotom
data.flavorText: Its body is composed of plasma. It is known to infiltrate electronic devices and wreak havoc.

abilities.name: Roto Motor
abilities.text: If you have 9 or more Pokémon Tool cards in your discard pile, ignore all Energy in the attack cost of each of this Pokémon's attacks.

data.name: Salandit
data.flavorText: Volcanoes or dry, craggy places are its home. It emanates a sweet-smelling poisonous gas that attracts bug Pokémon, then attacks them.

data.name: Alolan Sandshrew
data.flavorText: An ancient tradition of Alolan festivals, still carried on to this day, is a competition to slide Sandshrew across ice as far as one can.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

data.name: Turtonator
data.flavorText: It gushes fire and poisonous gases from its nostrils. Its dung is an explosive substance and can be put to various uses.

attacks.name: Searing Flame
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

data.name: Salazzle
data.flavorText: Filled with pheromones, its poisonous gas can be diluted to use in the production of luscious perfumes.

attacks.name: Panic Poison
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned, Confused, and Poisoned.

attacks.name: Hunter's Nails
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is affected by a Special Condition, this attack does 60 more damage.

data.name: Alolan Sandslash
data.flavorText: This Pokémon's steel spikes are sheathed in ice. Stabs from these spikes cause deep wounds and severe frostbite as well.

attacks.name: Spike Armor
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, if this Pokémon is damaged by an attack (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), put 6 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.

data.name: Alolan Vulpix
data.flavorText: It exhales air colder than -58 degrees Fahrenheit. Elderly people in Alola call this Pokémon by an older name—Keokeo.

attacks.name: Roar
attacks.text: Your opponent switches their Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Piplup
data.flavorText: Because it is very proud, it hates accepting food from people. Its thick down guards it from cold.

attacks.name: Splatter
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Piplup
data.flavorText: Because it is very proud, it hates accepting food from people. Its thick down guards it from cold.

data.name: Empoleon
data.flavorText: The three horns that extend from its beak attest to its power. The leader has the biggest horns.

attacks.name: Total Command
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage for each Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's).

attacks.name: Whirlpool
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Prinplup
data.flavorText: It lives a solitary life. Its wings deliver wicked blows that can snap even the thickest of trees.

attacks.name: Bubble Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Floatzel
data.flavorText: Its flotation sac developed as a result of pursuing aquatic prey. It can double as a rubber raft.

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Aqua Blast
attacks.text: Discard a Water Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Snover
data.flavorText: In the spring, it grows berries with the texture of frozen treats around its belly.

attacks.name: Ice Shard
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Fighting Pokémon, this attack does 40 more damage.

data.name: Buizel
data.flavorText: It inflates the flotation sac around its neck and pokes its head out of the water to see what is going on.

data.name: Glaceon-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Freezing Gaze
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, your opponent's Pokémon-GX and Pokémon-EX in play, in their hand, and in their discard pile have no Abilities, except for Freezing Gaze.

attacks.name: Frost Bullet
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Polar Spear-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage for each damage counter on your opponent's Active Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Abomasnow
data.flavorText: It lives a quiet life on mountains that are perpetually covered in snow. It hides itself by whipping up blizzards.

abilities.name: Blessings of the Frost
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may attach a Water Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hypno Hammer
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Wash Rotom
data.flavorText: Its body is composed of plasma. It is known to infiltrate electronic devices and wreak havoc.

abilities.name: Roto Motor
abilities.text: If you have 9 or more Pokémon Tool cards in your discard pile, ignore all Energy in the attack cost of each of this Pokémon's attacks.

attacks.name: Wash Arrow
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Frost Rotom
data.flavorText: Its body is composed of plasma. It is known to infiltrate electronic devices and wreak havoc.

abilities.name: Roto Motor
abilities.text: If you have 9 or more Pokémon Tool cards in your discard pile, ignore all Energy in the attack cost of each of this Pokémon's attacks.

attacks.name: Frost Crush
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage times the amount of Energy attached to all of your opponent's Pokémon.

data.name: Manaphy
data.flavorText: It starts its life with a wondrous power that permits it to bond with any kind of Pokémon.

attacks.name: Deep Currents
attacks.text: Shuffle 5 Water Energy cards from your discard pile into your deck.

attacks.name: Water Pulse
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Electabuzz
data.flavorText: Electricity leaks from it in amounts far greater than the amount of electricity it eats.

attacks.name: Thunder
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 30 damage to itself.

data.name: Shinx
data.flavorText: All of its fur dazzles if danger is sensed. It flees while the foe is momentarily blinded.

abilities.name: Evolutionary Advantage
abilities.text: If you go second, this Pokémon can evolve during your first turn.

data.name: Electivire
data.flavorText: When it gets excited, it thumps its chest. With every thud, thunder roars and electric sparks shower all around.

attacks.name: Steel Short
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Metal Pokémon, it is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Shinx
data.flavorText: All of its fur dazzles if danger is sensed. It flees while the foe is momentarily blinded.

attacks.name: Charge
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Lightning Energy card and attach it to this Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Luxio
data.flavorText: Strong electricity courses through the tips of its sharp claws. A light scratch causes fainting in foes.

attacks.name: Disconnect
attacks.text: Your opponent can't play any Item cards from their hand during their next turn.

data.name: Luxray
data.flavorText: Luxray's ability to see through objects comes in handy when it's scouting for danger.

abilities.name: Intimidating Fang
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, your opponent's Active Pokémon's attacks do 30 less damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Volt Bolt
attacks.text: Discard all Lightning Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 150 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Rotom
data.flavorText: Its body is composed of plasma. It is known to infiltrate electronic devices and wreak havoc.

abilities.name: Roto Motor
abilities.text: If you have 9 or more Pokémon Tool cards in your discard pile, ignore all Energy in the attack cost of each of this Pokémon's attacks.

attacks.name: Plasma Slice
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't attack during your next turn.

data.name: Pachirisu
data.flavorText: A pair may be seen rubbing their cheek pouches together in an effort to share stored electricity.

attacks.name: Snuggly Generator
attacks.text: For each of your Benched Pokémon that has the Nuzzle attack, search your deck for a Lightning Energy card and attach it to that Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Nuzzle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Drifloon
data.flavorText: If for some reason its body bursts, its soul spills out with a screaming sound.

attacks.name: Creepy Wind
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Drifblim
data.flavorText: Even while under careful observation, large flocks of Drifblim flying at dusk will inexplicably disappear from view.

attacks.name: Damage Transport
attacks.text: Move 4 damage counters from each of your Pokémon to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Wind Wheel
attacks.text: Your opponent switches their Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Spiritomb
data.flavorText: It was bound to a fissure in an Odd Keystone as punishment for misdeeds 500 years ago.

attacks.name: Lightless World
attacks.text: Put 2 Supporter cards from your discard pile into your hand.

attacks.name: Terrify
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is a Basic Pokémon, it can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Skorupi
data.flavorText: It burrows under the sand to lie in wait for prey. Its tail claws can inject its prey with a savage poison.

attacks.name: Hone Claws
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Pierce attack's base damage is 90.

data.name: Drapion
data.flavorText: It has the power in its clawed arms to make scrap of a car. The tips of its claws release poison.

attacks.name: Dangerous Stinger
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed and Poisoned.

data.name: Giratina ◇
data.flavorText: It was banished for its violence. It silently gazed upon the old world from the Distortion World.
rules: ◇ (Prism Star) Rule: You can't have more than 1 ◇ card with the same name in your deck. If a ◇ card would go to the discard pile, put it in the Lost Zone instead.

abilities.name: Chaotic Star
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may attach 2 Psychic Energy cards from your hand to it.

attacks.name: Crisis Dive
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Cresselia
data.flavorText: Those who sleep holding Cresselia's feather are assured of joyful dreams. It is said to represent the crescent moon.

attacks.name: Lunar Payback
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon. If you do, switch all damage counters on this Pokémon with those on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage times the amount of Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Toxicroak
data.flavorText: Its knuckle claws secrete a toxin so vile that even a scratch could prove fatal.

attacks.name: Poison Jab
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Exact Revenge
attacks.text: If any of your Fighting Pokémon were Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack during their last turn, this attack does 70 more damage.

data.name: Croagunk
data.flavorText: Inflating its poison sacs, it fills the area with an odd sound and hits flinching opponents with a poison jab.

attacks.name: Swagger
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Cosmog
data.flavorText: Its body is gaseous and frail. It slowly grows as it collects dust from the atmosphere.

attacks.name: Teleport
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Cosmoem
data.flavorText: There's something accumulating around the black core within its hard shell. People think this Pokémon may come from another world.

attacks.name: Teleport
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Dawn Wings Necrozma-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Invasion
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is on your Bench, you may switch it with your Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dark Flash
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

attacks.name: Moon's Eclipse-GX
attacks.text: You can use this attack only if you have more Prize cards remaining than your opponent. Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Lunala ◇
data.flavorText: Said to live in another world, this Pokémon devours light, drawing the moonless dark veil of night over the brightness of day.
rules: ◇ (Prism Star) Rule: You can't have more than 1 ◇ card with the same name in your deck. If a ◇ card would go to the discard pile, put it in the Lost Zone instead.

attacks.name: Full Moon Star
attacks.text: For each of your opponent's Pokémon in play, attach a Psychic Energy card from your discard pile to your Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Psystorm
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage times the amount of Energy attached to all Pokémon.

data.name: Cranidos
data.flavorText: In rock layers where Cranidos fossils are found, the fossilized trunks of trees snapped in two are also often found.

data.name: Rampardos
data.flavorText: Records exist of a revived fossil that evolved into Rampardos. It proceeded to escape and then destroy a skyscraper with a headbutt.

attacks.name: Clean Hit
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is an Evolution Pokémon, this attack does 60 more damage.

attacks.name: Wild Crash
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Basic Pokémon, it is Knocked Out.

data.name: Riolu
data.flavorText: It's tough enough to run right through the night, and it's also a hard worker, but it's still just a youngster.

attacks.name: Detect
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Lucario
data.flavorText: They can detect the species of a living being—and its emotions—from over half a mile away. They control auras and hunt their prey in packs.

abilities.name: Precognitive Aura
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if you have Garchomp in play, you may search your deck for a card and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Missile Jab
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

data.name: Hippopotas
data.flavorText: It enshrouds itself with sand to protect itself from germs. It does not enjoy getting wet.

attacks.name: Eleventh Hour Tackle
attacks.text: If there are 3 or fewer cards in your deck, this attack does 130 more damage.

data.name: Passimian
data.flavorText: They battle with hard berries for weapons. Their techniques are passed from the boss to the group, generation upon generation.

abilities.name: Power Huddle
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, your Passimian's attacks do 30 more damage to your opponent's Active Evolution Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Rock Hurl
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

data.name: Hippowdon
data.flavorText: It blasts internally stored sand from ports on its body to create a towering twister for attack.

attacks.name: Sand Tomb
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Dust Cannon
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each Colorless in your opponent's Active Pokémon's Retreat Cost.

data.name: Murkrow
data.flavorText: Seen as a symbol of bad luck, it's generally disliked. Yet it gives presents—objects that sparkle or shine—to Trainers it's close to.

attacks.name: Mean Look
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Honchkrow
data.flavorText: If its Murkrow cronies fail to catch food for it, or if it feels they have betrayed it, it will hunt them down wherever they are and punish them.

attacks.name: Rip and Run
attacks.text: Discard a random card from your opponent's hand. Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Weavile
data.flavorText: They dwell in cold places. This Pokémon's main food source in Alola is Vulpix and Sandshrew, which they carefully divide among their group.

attacks.name: Icy Wind
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Evil Admonition
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage for each of your opponent's Pokémon that has an Ability.

data.name: Sneasel
data.flavorText: It uses its claws to poke holes in eggs so it can slurp out the insides. Breeders consider it a scourge and will drive it away or eradicate it.

attacks.name: Sneaky Smash
attacks.text: You can use this attack only if you go second, and only on your first turn. Discard an Energy from 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Ambush
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.name: Stunky
data.flavorText: It protects itself by spraying a noxious fluid from its rear. The stench lingers for 24 hours.

attacks.name: Gas Bond
attacks.text: Both Active Pokémon are now Confused.

data.name: Darkrai ◇
data.flavorText: It can lull people to sleep and make them dream. It is active during nights of the new moon.
rules: ◇ (Prism Star) Rule: You can't have more than 1 ◇ card with the same name in your deck. If a ◇ card would go to the discard pile, put it in the Lost Zone instead.

abilities.name: Nightmare Star
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may attach 2 Darkness Energy cards from your hand to it.

attacks.name: Abyssal Sleep
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep. Your opponent flips 2 coins instead of 1 between turns. If either of them is tails, that Pokémon is still Asleep.

data.name: Skuntank
data.flavorText: It sprays a stinky fluid from its tail. The fluid smells worse the longer it is allowed to fester.

attacks.name: Sticky Smokescreen
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips 2 coins. If either of them is tails, that attack does nothing.

data.name: Alolan Diglett
data.flavorText: Its golden hairs function as sensors. It pokes them out of its burrow to monitor its surroundings.

attacks.name: Iron Head
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

data.name: Magnemite
data.flavorText: It sends out electromagnetic waves, which let it float through the air. Touching it while it's eating electricity will give you a full-body shock.

attacks.name: Searching Magnet
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 Metal Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Alolan Dugtrio
data.flavorText: These Pokémon are cherished in the Alola region, where they are thought to be feminine deities of the land incarnate.

attacks.name: Gold Rush
attacks.text: Discard any number of Metal Energy cards from your hand. This attack does 30 damage for each card you discarded in this way.

data.name: Magnemite
data.flavorText: It sends out electromagnetic waves, which let it float through the air. Touching it while it's eating electricity will give you a full-body shock.

abilities.name: Solid Unit
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).

data.name: Magneton
data.flavorText: It has about three times the electrical power of Magnemite. For some reason, outbreaks of this Pokémon happen when lots of sunspots appear.

attacks.name: Zap Cannon
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Zap Cannon during your next turn.

data.name: Magnezone
data.flavorText: As it zooms through the sky, this Pokémon seems to be receiving signals of unknown origin, while transmitting signals of unknown purpose.

abilities.name: Magnetic Circuit
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a Metal Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Zap Cannon
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Zap Cannon during your next turn.

data.name: Shieldon
data.flavorText: This Pokémon lived in primeval jungles. Few enemies would have been willing to square off against its heavily armored face, so it's thought.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

data.name: Bastiodon
data.flavorText: It lived in the same environments as Rampardos. Their fossils have been found together—seemingly from after they'd fought to the finish.

abilities.name: Earthen Shield
abilities.text: Prevent all damage done to your Metal Pokémon by attacks from your opponent's Pokémon that have any Special Energy attached to them.

attacks.name: Push Down
attacks.text: You may have your opponent switch their Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Bronzor
data.flavorText: Implements shaped like it were discovered in ancient tombs. It is unknown if they are related.

attacks.name: Hypnosis
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Solgaleo ◇
data.flavorText: This Pokémon is said to be a male evolution of Cosmog. At the activation of its third eye, it departs for another world.
rules: ◇ (Prism Star) Rule: You can't have more than 1 ◇ card with the same name in your deck. If a ◇ card would go to the discard pile, put it in the Lost Zone instead.

attacks.name: Radiant Star
attacks.text: For each of your opponent's Pokémon in play, attach a Metal Energy card from your discard pile to your Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Corona Impact
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't attack during your next turn.

data.name: Bronzong
data.flavorText: Ancient people believed that petitioning Bronzong for rain was the way to make crops grow.

attacks.name: Psy Bolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Psychic Resonance
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Psychic Pokémon in play, this attack does 60 more damage.

data.name: Heatran
data.flavorText: Boiling blood, like magma, circulates through its body. It makes its dwelling place in volcanic caves.

attacks.name: Guard Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Boiling Impact
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Magearna
data.flavorText: This artificial Pokémon, constructed more than 500 years ago, can understand human speech but cannot itself speak.

abilities.name: Change Clothes
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put a Pokémon Tool card attached to 1 of your Pokémon into your hand.

data.name: Dusk Mane Necrozma-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Meteor Tempest
attacks.text: Discard 3 Energy from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sun's Eclipse-GX
attacks.text: You can use this attack only if you have more Prize cards remaining than your opponent. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Morelull
data.flavorText: It scatters spores that flicker and glow. Anyone seeing these lights falls into a deep slumber.

attacks.name: Flickering Spores
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Gible
data.flavorText: It skulks in caves, and when prey or an enemy passes by, it leaps out and chomps them. The force of its attack sometimes chips its teeth.

abilities.name: Rock Hiding
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has any Fighting Energy attached to it, it has no Retreat Cost.

data.name: Shiinotic
data.flavorText: Forests where Shiinotic live are treacherous to enter at night. People confused by its strange lights can never find their way home again.

abilities.name: Illuminate
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for a Fairy Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Flickering Spores
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Tapu Lele
data.flavorText: This guardian deity of Akala is guilelessly cruel. The fragrant aroma of flowers is the source of its energy.

attacks.name: Psywave
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage times the amount of Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Magical Swap
attacks.text: Move any number of damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon to their other Pokémon in any way you like.

data.name: Alolan Exeggutor
data.flavorText: Alola is the best environment for this Pokémon. Local people take pride in its appearance, saying this is how Exeggutor ought to look.

attacks.name: Exeggutor's Paradise
attacks.text: For each of your Benched Exeggcute, search your deck for an Alolan Exeggutor or Alolan Exeggutor-GX and put it onto that Exeggcute to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Draco Meteor Barrage
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each Grass Energy attached to this Pokémon. This attack does 80 damage for each heads.

data.name: Gible
data.flavorText: It skulks in caves, and when prey or an enemy passes by, it leaps out and chomps them. The force of its attack sometimes chips its teeth.

attacks.name: Ascension
attacks.text: Search your deck for a card that evolves from this Pokémon and put it onto this Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Dialga-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Overclock
attacks.text: Draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand.

attacks.name: Shred
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Timeless-GX
attacks.text: Take another turn after this one. (Skip the between-turns step.) (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Palkia-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Spatial Control
attacks.text: Move any number of Energy from your Benched Pokémon to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hydro Pressure
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage times the amount of Water Energy attached to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Zero Vanish-GX
attacks.text: Shuffle all Energy from each of your opponent's Pokémon into their deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Garchomp
data.flavorText: The protuberances on its head serve as sensors. It can even detect distant prey.

attacks.name: Quick Dive
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Royal Blades
attacks.text: If you played Cynthia from your hand during this turn, this attack does 100 more damage.

data.name: Gabite
data.flavorText: Shiny objects are its passion. It can be found in its cave, scarcely moving, its gaze fixed on the jewels it's amassed or Carbink it has caught.

attacks.name: Ascension
attacks.text: Search your deck for a card that evolves from this Pokémon and put it onto this Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Lickitung
data.flavorText: Its tongue is twice the length of its body. It can be moved like an arm for grabbing food and attacking.

attacks.name: Lap Up
attacks.text: Draw 3 cards.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 50 damage for each heads.

data.name: Lickilicky
data.flavorText: Their saliva contains lots of components that can dissolve anything. The numbness caused by their lick does not dissipate.

attacks.name: Dangerous Lick
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 50 more damage for each heads. If the first flip is tails, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Eevee
data.flavorText: Current studies show it can evolve into an incredible eight different species of Pokémon.

data.name: Eevee
data.flavorText: Possessing an unbalanced and unstable genetic makeup, it conceals many possible evolutions.

attacks.name: Palette of Friends
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage for each different type of Pokémon on your Bench.

data.name: Buneary
data.flavorText: When it senses danger, it perks up its ears. On cold nights, it sleeps with its head tucked into its fur.

attacks.name: Weak Kneed
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

data.name: Lopunny
data.flavorText: The ears appear to be delicate. If they are touched roughly, it kicks with its graceful legs.

attacks.name: Stompy Stomp
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Happy Turn
attacks.text: You may shuffle this Pokémon and all cards attached to it into your deck.

data.name: Glameow
data.flavorText: When it's happy, Glameow demonstrates beautiful movements of its tail, like a dancing ribbon.

attacks.name: Gentle Bite
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon's attacks do 40 less damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Purugly
data.flavorText: To make itself appear intimidatingly beefy, it tightly cinches its waist with its twin tails.

attacks.name: Own the Place
attacks.text: If your opponent has a Stadium card in play, discard it. If you do, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Toss Aside
attacks.text: Discard random cards from your opponent's hand until they have 3 cards in their hand.

data.name: Fan Rotom
data.flavorText: Its body is composed of plasma. It is known to infiltrate electronic devices and wreak havoc.

abilities.name: Roto Motor
abilities.text: If you have 9 or more Pokémon Tool cards in your discard pile, ignore all Energy in the attack cost of each of this Pokémon's attacks.

attacks.name: Spinning Fan
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Shaymin
data.flavorText: The blooming of Gracidea flowers confers the power of flight upon it. Feelings of gratitude are the message it delivers.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Yungoos
data.flavorText: It wanders around in a never-ending search for food. At dusk, it collapses from exhaustion and falls asleep on the spot.

attacks.name: Scout
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals their hand.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

data.name: Gumshoos
data.flavorText: It adores having Rattata and Raticate for dinner, but as it's diurnal, it never encounters them. This Pokémon boasts incredible patience.

attacks.name: Identify
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals their hand. If you find a Pokémon there, this attack does 80 more damage.

data.name: Drampa
data.flavorText: This Pokémon is friendly to people and loves children most of all. It comes from deep in the mountains to play with children it likes in town.

attacks.name: Outrage
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dragon Pulse
attacks.text: Discard the top 2 cards of your deck.

data.name: Ancient Crystal
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
The Regirock, Regice, Registeel, or Regigigas this card is attached to takes 30 less damage from your opponent's attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Cynthia
rules: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw 6 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Oranguru
data.flavorText: Deep in the jungle, high in the lofty canopy, this Pokémon abides. On rare occasions, it shows up at the beach to match wits with Slowking.

attacks.name: Resource Management
attacks.text: Put 3 cards from your discard pile on the bottom of your deck in any order.

attacks.name: Profound Knowledge
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Silvally-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Gyro Unit
abilities.text: Your Basic Pokémon in play have no Retreat Cost.

attacks.name: Turbo Drive
attacks.text: Attach a basic Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Rebel-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage for each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Type: Null
data.flavorText: The heavy control mask it wears suppresses its intrinsic capabilities. This Pokémon has some hidden special power.

attacks.name: Merciless Strike
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.name: Cynthia
rules: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw 6 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Cyrus ◇
rules: You can play this card only if your Active Pokémon is a Water or Metal Pokémon.
Your opponent chooses 2 Benched Pokémon and shuffles the others, and all cards attached to them, into their deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).
◇ (Prism Star) Rule: You can't have more than 1 ◇ card with the same name in your deck. If a ◇ card would go to the discard pile, put it in the Lost Zone instead.

data.name: Electric Memory
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
The Silvally-GX this card is attached to is a Lightning Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Escape Board
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
The Retreat Cost of the Pokémon this card is attached to is Colorless less, and it can retreat even if it's Asleep or Paralyzed.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Gardenia
rules: Heal 80 damage from 1 of your Pokémon that has any Grass Energy attached to it.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Lillie
rules: Draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand. If it's your first turn, draw cards until you have 8 cards in your hand.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Lillie
rules: Draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand. If it's your first turn, draw cards until you have 8 cards in your hand.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Escape Board
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
The Retreat Cost of the Pokémon this card is attached to is Colorless less, and it can retreat even if it's Asleep or Paralyzed.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Fire Memory
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
The Silvally-GX this card is attached to is a Fire Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Looker
rules: Draw 3 cards from the bottom of your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Looker Whistle
rules: Search your deck for up to 2 cards named Looker, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Volkner
rules: Search your deck for an Item card and a Lightning Energy card, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Pal Pad
rules: Shuffle 2 Supporter cards from your discard pile into your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Unidentified Fossil
rules: Play this card as if it were a 60-HP Colorless Basic Pokémon. At any time during your turn (before your attack), you may discard this card from play.
This card can't retreat.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Volkner
rules: Search your deck for an Item card and a Lightning Energy card, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Pheromosa-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Fast Raid
attacks.text: If you go first, you can use this attack on your first turn.

attacks.name: Cruel Spike
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Beauty-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage for each Prize card your opponent has taken. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Mars
rules: Draw 2 cards. If you do, discard a random card from your opponent's hand.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Missing Clover
rules:
You may play 4 Missing Clover cards at once.
• If you played 1 card, look at the top card of your deck.
• If you played 4 cards, take a Prize card. (This effect works one time for 4 cards.)
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Mt. Coronet
rules: Once during each player's turn, that player may put 2 Metal Energy cards from their discard pile into their hand.
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

data.name: Order Pad
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for an Item card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Pokémon Fan Club
rules: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Unit Energy GrassFireWater
rules: This card provides Colorless Energy.
While this card is attached to a Pokémon, it provides Grass, Fire, and Water Energy but provides only 1 Energy at a time.

data.name: Xurkitree-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Flashing Head
abilities.text: Prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from your opponent's Pokémon that have any Special Energy attached to them.

attacks.name: Rumbling Wires
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Lighting-GX
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals their hand. Add a card you find there to their Prize cards face down. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Super Boost Energy ◇
rules: This card provides Colorless Energy.

While this card is attached to a Stage 2 Pokémon, it provides every type of Energy but provides only 1 Energy at a time. If you have 3 or more Stage 2 Pokémon in play, it provides every type of Energy but provides 4 Energy at a time.
◇ (Prism Star) Rule: You can't have more than 1 ◇ card with the same name in your deck. If a ◇ card would go to the discard pile, put it in the Lost Zone instead.

data.name: Glaceon-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Freezing Gaze
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, your opponent's Pokémon-GX and Pokémon-EX in play, in their hand, and in their discard pile have no Abilities, except for Freezing Gaze.

attacks.name: Frost Bullet
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Polar Spear-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage for each damage counter on your opponent's Active Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Cynthia
rules: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw 6 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Gardenia
rules: Heal 80 damage from 1 of your Pokémon that has any Grass Energy attached to it.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Dawn Wings Necrozma-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Invasion
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is on your Bench, you may switch it with your Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dark Flash
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

attacks.name: Moon's Eclipse-GX
attacks.text: You can use this attack only if you have more Prize cards remaining than your opponent. Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Unit Energy LightningPsychicMetal
rules: This card provides Colorless Energy.
While this card is attached to a Pokémon, it provides Lightning, Psychic, and Metal Energy but provides only 1 Energy at a time.

data.name: Leafeon-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Breath of the Leaves
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, once during your turn (before your attack), you may heal 50 damage from 1 of your Pokémon that has any Energy attached to it.

attacks.name: Grand Bloom-GX
attacks.text: For each of your Benched Basic Pokémon, search your deck for a card that evolves from that Pokémon and put it onto that Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Celesteela-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Rocket Fall
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Colorless in your opponent's Active Pokémon's Retreat Cost.

attacks.name: Blaster-GX
attacks.text: Turn all of your Prize cards face up. (Those Prize cards remain face up for the rest of the game.) (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Lusamine
rules: Put 2 in any combination of Supporter and Stadium cards from your discard pile into your hand.

abilities.name: Ultra Road
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may switch your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sunsteel Strike
attacks.text: Discard all Energy from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sol Burst-GX
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 5 Energy cards and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Lunala-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Psychic Transfer
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move a Psychic Energy from 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Moongeist Beam
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't be healed during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Lunar Fall-GX
attacks.text: Knock Out 1 of your opponent's Basic Pokémon that isn't a Pokémon-GX. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Mars
rules: Draw 2 cards. If you do, discard a random card from your opponent's hand.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Volkner
rules: Search your deck for an Item card and a Lightning Energy card, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Palkia-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Spatial Control
attacks.text: Move any number of Energy from your Benched Pokémon to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hydro Pressure
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage times the amount of Water Energy attached to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Zero Vanish-GX
attacks.text: Shuffle all Energy from each of your opponent's Pokémon into their deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Leafeon-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Breath of the Leaves
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, once during your turn (before your attack), you may heal 50 damage from 1 of your Pokémon that has any Energy attached to it.

attacks.name: Grand Bloom-GX
attacks.text: For each of your Benched Basic Pokémon, search your deck for a card that evolves from that Pokémon and put it onto that Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Xurkitree-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Flashing Head
abilities.text: Prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from your opponent's Pokémon that have any Special Energy attached to them.

attacks.name: Rumbling Wires
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Lighting-GX
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals their hand. Add a card you find there to their Prize cards face down. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Peeking Red Card
rules: Your opponent reveals their hand. You may have your opponent count the cards in their hand, shuffle those cards into their deck, then draw that many cards.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Unit Energy LightningPsychicMetal
rules: This card provides Colorless Energy.
While this card is attached to a Pokémon, it provides Lightning, Psychic, and Metal Energy but provides only 1 Energy at a time.

data.name: Escape Board
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
The Retreat Cost of the Pokémon this card is attached to is Colorless less, and it can retreat even if it's Asleep or Paralyzed.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Missing Clover
rules:
You may play 4 Missing Clover cards at once.
• If you played 1 card, look at the top card of your deck.
• If you played 4 cards, take a Prize card. (This effect works one time for 4 cards.)
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).
